5639525743D644D6A2014C3BA823CBD3.description: use appropriate visual and/or digital tools to enhance verbal communication and add interest. (LA.7.SL.2.c)

2D90D4770F83486AA1DE9A571466D23B.description: demonstrate awareness of and sensitivity to the appropriate use of words (e.g., stereotypes, multiple meanings of words). (LA.7.SL.2.d)

5911F15A11E84AD09ED5A149997D158C.description: analyze the purpose and credibility of information being presented. (LA.7.SL.2.c)

785B3DCABE8443CC8156D5165CFC07FD.description: convey a perspective with clear reasoning and valid evidence. (LA.7.SL.2.b)

EC99EAF5A9CE4B13AAE90DF10B096BA0.description: demonstrate and adjust speaking techniques (e.g., appropriate eye contact, pacing, adequate volume, clear pronunciation) for a variety of purposes and situations, including interpreting 7th grade texts. (LA.7.SL.2.a)

C7659097CB5A4059A1C120E9F0657496.description: Students will present claims, information, findings, and supporting evidence at grade level; in which the organization, development, and style are appropriate to the discipline, audience, and/or content.

4AE8D0CBF1B4461AB83D8F6695D30145.description: complete a task following multi-step directions. (LA.7.SL.1.e)

954EAF88D41C407FBB99F13F8AE8F731.description: demonstrate active and attentive listening skills (e.g., eye contact, nonverbal cues, taking notes, summarizing, questioning). (LA.7.SL.1.d)

41341E9E6EF34B5EA3858B5AC8108E3C.description: converse with peers and adults in an all-inclusive manner to foster positive relationships while respecting diverse perspectives. (LA.7.SL.1.c)

EA42FE954FD14898ACBC8B642EB204A3.description: demonstrate interpretations of verbal and non-verbal messages in a conversation.  (LA.7.SL.1.b)

C81CA619C1CE4E8FB619029C170FA881.description: ask relevant questions to build on ideas, clarify their own ideas, or acquire or confirm information. (LA.7.SL.1.a)

F6A6E18AD3244AF1AD83D64490DFF2B5.description: Students will communicate effectively and appropriately in collaborative activities at grade-level; for a variety of tasks, purposes, and audiences to express ideas, share knowledge, and generate new understanding

507DEE6E82D74F8BBE9F8F93DAC54A17.description: practice safe and ethical behaviors when communicating and interacting with others digitally (e.g., safe information to share, utilize appropriate sites and materials, appropriate language use, respect diverse perspectives). (LA.7.W.6.e)

29D3F52E5C9048F8BA4519B9A856718E.description: demonstrate academic integrity by avoiding overreliance on any one source and citing sources within text (e.g., parenthetical and numerical); provide a list of sources using a standard format. (LA.7.W.6.d)

68AC73D3723B45098BF743C693BD3E58.description: select and use appropriate note-taking formats to collect and organize information. (LA.7.W.6.c)

DD1EFD886F714881970F5025FFB0E370.description: locate and evaluate the credibility of evidence (e.g., motivation and/or potential bias of an information product) from print and digital sources to generate and answer questions and create new understandings. (LA.7.W.6.b)

D0885AA4E80F4E0ABA65707A69E129BA.description: integrate evidence into writing by quoting or paraphrasing data and conclusions while avoiding plagiarism. (LA.7.W.6.a)

F29306E19A4E4DF6B280998C56BB33B6.description: Students will gather and use credible evidence from multiple trustworthy sources and assess its relevance in answering the research question, at grade level.

9285B3A9482B4E5DB9A6E0E3CCDCABFE.description: provide a concluding statement or section that follows from the information or explanations(s). (LA.7.W.5.d)

CF32B1C6DBEA46B3856C599A98564C74.description: use appropriate transitions and key vocabulary to clarify relationships among ideas and concepts. (LA.7.W.5.c)

CF3805A6E02543BE865EA026FCEA86D2.description: develop a topic with information (e.g., facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, examples) related to the topic. (LA.7.W.5.b)

46578D6292674ED68711CA66EAF1F13E.description: develop a clear topic and provide a specific focus, grouping information logically and including text features, illustrations, and/or multimedia elements. (LA.7.W.5.a)

55D47827A9CB45D59F4CA89E06DEFDDA.description: Students will write informative/explanatory pieces to examine a topic or text and clearly convey ideas and information at grade level.

3C16CD1F42D84389806731410105F841.description: provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the argument(s) presented. (LA.7.3.1.d)

CEE19C06A6F64F1295801BE5D70F7DAC.description: use words, phrases, and key vocabulary to create cohesion and clarify the relationship between claims (s) and supporting evidence.. (LA.7.W.4.c)

7785698257AA41398CAF67505C6D0E87.description: explain and cite relevant evidence from multiple credible sources. (LA.7.W.4.b)

5A7C9DE2A78B483D8A23F4B15B28C2FE.description: develop a structure to sequence ideas appropriately; introduce a clear claim where appropriate. (LA.7.W.4.a)

D844E07C8D094E8BA12CD3025FB15FAD.description: Students will write and cite arguments that develop a perspective with supporting reasons and evidence, organized as appropriate to the task, purpose, and audience.

E4294C57E3194B32908C2FBECD59A06B.description: provide a conclusion that is clearly related to and appropriately reflects on the literary experiences or events. (LA.7.W.3.e)

B9C9D66C1E1F4D8587DF5378DEAF2D5F.description: use precise words and phrases, descriptive/sensory details, and figurative language to express personal or narrative voice. (LA.7.W.3.d)

FA83550BDE2C49F29AE775B78893E18B.description: use a variety of transitional words and phrases to signal shifts from one character, timeframe, or setting to another. (LA.7.W.3.c)

4F4693CE1E0A4215B239D9CCDF78D8CC.description: use literary techniques (e.g., dialogue, pacing, description) to develop characters, events, settings, and conflicts.(LA.7.W.3.b)

32B532EFB15D4FDB97F6DF1E0AB6F807.description: engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and introducing a narrator and/or character(s) establishing and maintaining a point of view, and organizing an event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically.(LA.7.W.3.a)

87ED65622D264BBA89A2C09F919BC291.description: Students will write in a variety of literary forms to convey real or imagined experiences or events in which the development and structure are appropriate to the task, purpose, and audience, at grade level.

C901D58246E54CE4A0AE932835F43102.description: use appropriate print and digital/multimedia tools to produce, enhance, and/or publish writing individually or in collaboration with peers. (LA.7.W.2.e)

92C014885C094FC48DCB7B487B60D757.description: improve and clarify writing by editing and proofreading, considering feedback from adults and peers. (LA.7.W.2.d)

6100C4C9BEF74079BE7E7CFC0D608A45.description: improve and clarify the content, structure, and organization of writing by revising, considering feedback from adults and peers. (LA.7.W.2.c)

B5B16BE4111A4D8AA3CF2A513B6BC262.description: adapt writing processes to sustain engagement in short and long-term writing tasks of increasing length and complexity. (LA.7.W.2.b)

EC987C6E0E3244C1852C51A0978A4B03.description: use prewriting activities and inquiry tools to plan, organize, and draft writing. (LA.7.W.2.a)

7869188F64674A3E8B9AA700421A52F2.description: Students will use a recursive writing process to develop, strengthen, and produce writing at grade level, appropriate to the audience, purpose, and discipline.

D460134A1E3D4B9880046EF7D83976F3.description: identify and revise fragment and run-on sentences and inappropriate shifts in verb tenses. (LA.7.W.1.e)

14D27BFF6EEF45FBBD835E495D55E19B.description: use a variety of prepositional and appositive phrases in sentences and paragraphs. (LA.7.W.1.d)

190781584F124CA1A49A504B1FDC7146.description: distinguish between and use types of clauses (e.g., noun, relative, adverbial), modifiers (e.g., misplaced and dangling), and adjectives (coordinate and cumulative). (LA.7.W.1.c)

C1BEFFC839EE4C3EA8575C876FFE2299.description: use a comma to separate coordinate adjectives (LA.7.W.1.b)

2953AAC5BA504CB89E28DD69DA1D1C4F.description: apply knowledge of rules for capitalization. (LA.7.W.1.a)

75EF4D6128C247FBB6A19E6EE1BAABEE.description: Students will use a recursive writing process to produce clear and coherent multi-paragraph compositions appropriate to the discipline, audience, and /or context.

28F9041FBFD54A0981962AD833EE7C74.description: demonstrate conversational, academic, and discipline specific vocabulary when speaking and writing. (LA.7.V.1)

167756986F0C42448FFBF25ED8B8740B.description: distinguish between the connotations of words with similar denotations (e.g., plight, diplomatic). (LA.7.V.2.c)

4512FA341920444484B47DE41978A7F9.description: determine the relationship between words (e.g., cause/effect, part/whole, item/category). (LA.7.V.2.b)

85593FA42F04460894A11D9A891ABE0A.description: interpret figures of speech (e.g., literary, biblical, or mythological allusions) in context. (LA.7.V.2.a)

25B9654A620B41B7905D6AA6D7BBF240.description: interpret an author’s use of figurative, connotative, and technical language in grade-level literary and informational text. (LA.7.V.2)

5BD808E769704102B450314E25573E9A.description: consult general and specialized reference materials to determine or clarify the precise meanings, pronunciations, or parts of speech of words.(LA.7.V.1.c)

DB7ECB1970274FB0934B6DBCBEB46F48.description: use commonly occurring Greek and Latin affixes and roots to determine the meanings of words (e.g., audience, audible). (LA.7.V.1.b)

10681B84C77243109C97E18B96F2D212.description: uses context clues (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word’s position or function in a sentence) to determine the meanings of words and phrases. (LA.7.V.1.a)

1CF473D6DAA441A8B87A00D06B4CF558.description: Students will use a variety of strategies to determine the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning grade-level words and phrases when reading and listening; and use a range of conversational, academic, and discipline specific vocabulary when speaking and writing.

479CED94D98A44EB9B350683D44AECF2.description: read and comprehend a wide range of informational texts of appropriate complexity for the 7th grade, proficiently. (LA.7.RI.8)

B04ACA33EC2F48BAAC2305355C008C10.description: compare and contrast regional, national,and/or multicultural perspectives by explaining how an author or narrator/speaker introduces, illustrates, or describes characters or individuals, events, and ideas within and across informational texts. (LA.7.RI.7)

AC96983143E3403986642E06BF6076DB.description: analyze the development of an argument and identify the type(s) of reasoning used to support the argument. (LA.7.RI.6)

A6B159D805D44DB8B602F1F8CFE717BB.description: analyze how the major sections of text contribute to the development of ideas in an informational text. (LA.7.RI.4, LA.7.RI.5)

66EF63CBE587481D9884E7120BD9F518.description: analyze how an author establishes or conveys a perspective or purpose and distinguishes it from that of others. (LA.7.RI.3)

DC26D6393DDE4B74A40F40FDA9F4718D.description: analyze the relationships and interactions between individuals, events, and/or ideas or concepts, drawing on specific supporting details in an informational text. (LA.7.RI.2)

FEF6F903D5C347BEB6D1F6AC429C0288.description: determine two or more implied or explicit central ideas of an informational text and how they are supported with key details. (LA.7.RI.1)

57D1FF595DB54BCAA4D34DA06EE08D3A.description: Students will cite relevant and thorough textual evidence to support ideas, evaluate the development of theme or central ideas, interaction of individual ideas, events, and how an author’s perspective or use of point of view shapes the style and meaning in grade-level informational text.

BF6F8EFB7BCA4B5DAA81F0A5D60F8DE3.description: read and comprehend a wide range of literary texts of appropriate complexity for the 7th grade, proficiently. (LA.7.RP.8)

06C4A0DCAB9346FCA24131D6B891E51A.description: compare and contrast regional, national, and/or multicultural perspectives by explaining how an author or narrator/speaker introduces, illustrates, or describes characters or individuals, events, and ideas within and across literary texts. (LA.7.RP.7)

08C2DF08D31E44A9A765776307B50A5E.description: synthesize the implied or stated theme(s) in a literary text to draw conclusions and deepen understanding of self and others. (LA.7.RP.6)

AEED581A1AD24EE6B77435DF86D0ABE7.description: compare and contrast a fictional portrayal of a time, place, or character and a historical account of the same period. (LA.7.RP.5)

4F29EF6300EE4B34ABBE25533C66D01B.description: Students will cite relevant and thorough textual evidence to support ideas, evaluate how an author’s perspective or use of point of view shapes the style and meaning of grade level literary text.

A56D1312C61B4F60A29014C709681473.description: analyze the structure of a literary text, and how the structure contributes to its theme(s) and meaning. (LA.7.RP.4)

9689EAF6361040619352C083269C81A6.description: analyze how an author establishes, conveys, and contrasts the points of view of different characters or narrators in a literary text. (LA.7.RP.3)

0854A6774E154709B56F49A87572D974.description: analyze how particular events, lines of dialogue, or descriptive details develop the plot, reveal aspects of characters, or create meaning. (LA.7.RP.2)

1D30574FD24347249D3C789C37FC5161.description: determine two or more implied or explicit themes in a literary text and how they are supported with key details. (LA.7.RP.1)

79F5A49C65F94F5D94BD511FA642EE21.description: Students will use relevant and thorough textual evidence to support ideas, evaluate the development of theme or central ideas in grade-level literary text.
